result.title: SI@UCF – 2015 Summer Programming Training Camp for High School Students (Orlando, FL)
result.content:
The University of Central Florida is proud to offer a summer training camp for high school students interested in programming competitions. Our target audience are US students who aim to do well in USACO who haven’t been chosen as finalists for the USACO summer training camp.

The camp runs from June 15, 2015 – June 26, 2015 and housing will be provided in dormitories on campus.

Website: http://siucf.cs.ucf.edu/. (Click on the “Programming Competition” tab.)

Contact: dmarino@cs.ucf.edu (Arup Guha)

UCF’s programming team has performed well in the South East Regional over the last 30 years. The team has qualified for World Finals every year since 2004 except for 2011. Ironically, that was the year the contest was held in Orlando! Joining me as a camp instructor is Matt Fontaine, an ACM ICPC World Finalist for UCF from 2012. Matt has written rounds for TopCoder, questions for the South East Regional Programming Competition and the North American Invitational Programming Contest. In addition, other UCF team members and coaches will support the camp as well.

We hope that some of you will join us for our inaugural camp!

Arup Guha
